meanings.definition: To propel a bicycle by operating the pedals.
meanings.sent1: She pedalled her bike to the park.
meanings.sent2: He pedalled quickly to catch up with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The bear pedalled the bicycle in the circus act.
meanings.sent4: Her heart pedalled with excitement as she raced towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pedals being pedalled echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To operate a foot-operated lever or control.
meanings.sent1: He pedalled the sewing machine to stitch the fabric together.
meanings.sent2: She pedalled the gas pedal to make the car go faster.
meanings.sent3: The chef pedalled the mixer to whip up the batter.
meanings.sent4: His fingers pedalled the piano keys with precision.
meanings.sent5: The drummer pedalled the bass drum to keep the beat.

meanings.definition: To move by working the pedals of a bicycle.
meanings.sent1: They pedalled slowly up the hill, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent2: The kids pedalled their bikes around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The penguin pedalled the tiny bike comically at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Time pedalled forward as she rode through the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The old bicycle pedalled its way through history, witnessing many events.
